content:
### List of intents, their descriptions and slots.

        1. Intent_Id: ScIsSup301
	Intent_Name: ScannerIssueSupport
        Intent_Description: User reports issues with a scanner and requires assistance with  configuration, setup, or troubleshooting.
        Slots:
	slotID: ScPr991
	• slotName: scannerProblem
	Type: String
	Slot_description: Specifies the nature of the issue the user is facing with the scanner.
	Possible_Values: "Not Scanning", "Paper Jam", "Connection Issues", "Other"
	• slotID: ScMod727
	slotName: ScannerModel
	Type: String
	Slot_description: Specifies the model or type of the scanner the user is encountering issues with.
	• slotID: OpS7271
	slotName: OperatingSystem
	Type: String
	Slot_description: Specifies the user's operating system to tailor support based on the platform.
	Possible_Values: "Windows", "macOS", "Linux", "Other"
	• slotID: EMes8292
	slotName: ErrorMessage
	Type: String
	Slot_description: Allows the user to provide any error messages or specific details related to the scanner issue.


	2. Intent_Id: LAAdAcR525
	Intent_Name: LocalAdminAccessRequest
	Intent _Description: User requests local administrator access for tasks such as installing new software, accessing a system feature, or changing settings on their own local computer.
         Slots:
	• slotID: AcRT637
          slotName: AccessRequestType
	Slot_description: Specifies the type of access the user is requesting, such as installing new software, accessing a specific system feature, or changing settings.
	Type: String
	PossibleValues: "InstallSoftware", " AccessFeature", "ChangeSettings".
	• slotID: SNa8472
         slotName: SoftwareName
	Slot_description: Specifies the name or type of software the user wants to install.
	Type: String
	• slotID: FeatN2891
         slotName: FeatureName
         Slot_description: specifies the name or description of the feature, If the access request is related to accessing a specific system feature.
	Type: String
	Possible_Values: "Data Retrieval", File Management", "Software Development", "Financial Transactions", "Analytics Dashboard"
	• slotID: SetC301
        slotName: SettingsChange
	Slot_description:  Specifies the nature of the settings the user wants to change.
	Type: String

	3. Intent_Id: EmAcIs728
	Intent_Name: EmailIssues
	Intent_Description: User reports issues related to email access, updating, delivery, external emails, and reporting spam/phishing.
	Slots:
	• slotID: ITy291
	slotName: IssueType
	Slot_description: Specifies the type of email issue the user is experiencing.
	Type: String 
	Possible_Values: "Access", "Updating", "Delivery", "ExternalEmails", "SpamPhishing"	
	• slotID: EmAc930
	slotName: EmailAccount
	Slot_description: Allows the user to specify the email account or domain affected by the issue
	Type: String	
	• slotID: EmC3019
	slotName: EmailClient
	Slot_description: Indicates the email client or platform being used, providing context for troubleshooting.
	Type: Enum 
	Possible_Values: "Webmail", "Outlook", "Thunderbird", "Other".	
	
	4. Intent_Id: ConIeh3772
	Intent Name: ConcurInquiry
	Intent Description: User has an inquiry or concern about the Concur system
	Slots:
	• slotID: InT7391
	slotName: InquiryType
	Slot_description: Specifies the type of inquiry or concern the user has within the Concur system.
	Type: String 
	Possible_Values: "SystemConcern", "TravelExpensing", "BusinessPurchases", "TravelBooking", "ExpenseReports".
	• slotID: ExCat019
	slotName: ExpenseCategory
	Slot_description: Specifies the relevant category related to expensing travel costs or business purchases.
	Type: String 
	Possible_Values: "TravelCosts", "BusinessPurchases"
	• slotID: TrBo094
	slotName: TravelBooking
	Slot_description: specifies the type of travel being booked for business travel.
	Type: Enum
	Possible_Values: "Flight", "Hotel", "CarRental", "Other"
	• slotID: RepSt2719
	slotName: ReportStatus
	Slot_description:  indicates whether the user is creating a new report or submitting an existing one.
	Type: String 
	Possible_Values: "Creating", "Submitting"

### INSTRUCTIONS :
You are a system that performs the following tasks.  
First, carefully go through all the above listed intents.  Each intent has a unique ID associated with it and the descriptions associated with each intent, and some constraints required for each intent.  
 
For each intent there are also slots associated with them.  Slots are values that need to be retrieved for a particular intent.  Each slot will have a name, datatype, and description.  It may also include a field possibleValues which means the slot must match one of the provided values.  It could also include a field exampleValues where examples are given but the extracted slots do not need to exactly match those given values.  If multiple slots are provided, fill all the slots.  If a slot is not provided, set the value of the slot to "None" 
 
For the utterance provided below You should determine which intent would best match the user’s request.  If there are multiple intents, that would match the utterance equally well, make sure to output both. If f none of the intents match, return N/A. For each chosen intent, extract the slots if present and set the slot value to "None" if it is not present. 
 
Give your final output as a JSON.  The JSON should always have a key “output”.  The value of “output” should be a dictionary where the key of this dictionary is the intent id and the values is a subdictionary where the keys are the slot ids associated with the given intent and the values are the slot values.  All possible slots keys should be present in the JSON for a given intent even if the slot value does not exist in the utterance.  

### Utterance: 
“I’m requesting permission to download and install the Tableau to my computer. Tableau Software can connect to data sources such as regular text files (.txt, .csv), Microsoft Excel (.xlsx), Microsoft Access (.accdb), therefore it will be very useful for me to prepare reports for the management. I need it to be installed in 2 days at latest. ”
